intro: Hieracium vurtopicum subsp. semipseudocaesiiforme, commonly known as the pale yellow hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a distinctive, pale central disc. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
